author: Bengaluru Bureau
text:
The controversial episode of Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah receiving an expensive watch as gift resulted in commotion in both the Houses of the State legislature on Tuesday.

The ruling and the Opposition members indulged in a war of words as the Bharatiya Janata Party insisted on a debate on the issue through an adjournment motion that has censuring provisions.

Launching a counter attack, the Congress members displayed photographs of former Chief Ministers wearing expensive watches.

In the Assembly, soon after the obituary reference, Speaker Kagodu Thimmappa permitted Leader of the Opposition Jagadish Shettar to make a preliminary submission on the admissibility of the adjournment motion sought to be moved by the party.

Even as the Congress members took exception to this, Mr. Shettar said, “The watch issue is not a simple or personal issue” and it was a matter of public importance. He accused Mr. Siddaramaiah of violating the code of conduct for ministers and the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA). He demanded an explanation from the Chief Minister.

Mr. Shettar said the Chief Minister should not be scared of disclosing details about his gift. Reacting sharply, Mr. Siddaramaiah reminded the BJP of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s “Rs. 10 lakh suit.”

Mr. Siddaramaiah accused the Opposition of indulging in character assassination.

Ruling and Opposition members indulge in war of words; Houses adjourned
title: Ruckus over Siddaramaiah’s expensive watch
